p: The SARS-CoV-2 differs from the previous SARS and Middle East respiratory syndrome (MERS) coronaviruses. Although the early clinical manifestations are similar, SARS presented a higher virulence, reaching a mortality rate during the 2002 epidemic of about 9.5% [ 5], while in 2012 the MERS coronavirus epidemic reached a mortality rate greater than 30% in Saudi Arabia [ 6]. At the time of this writing, SARS-CoV-2 appears to be more contagious than these other two viruses with over 30â€‰000 cases in a 2-month period; however, the mortality rate has not exceeded 2%, targeting mainly the elderly and the fragile.
